description: This project in Forest Gate’s Woodgrange Conservation Area is a sensitive and imaginative extension of a traditional Victorian family home. Designed to enhance day-to-day living while preserving the charm and character of the original building, the scheme demonstrates how modern interventions can respectfully adapt historic homes to contemporary needs.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: The Architect of the project will be present to answer questions and show guests around.

facilities: Handrails on one side of stairs

factsheet.heading: Key features
paragraphs:
The extension introduces a green roof, offering ecological benefits, improved insulation, and a softened visual profile from above. This sustainable touch underscores the project’s forward-thinking ethos while respecting its surroundings within the conservation area.
A key feature is an elegant bamboo window seat overlooking new planters and thoughtfully integrated into the new layout. This charming element not only adds character but also provides a place of quiet retreat, linking indoor living spaces with views of the garden. It’s a small but powerful gesture that captures the spirit of the project: bringing comfort, light, and life back into a previously disconnected home. Another key feature of the project is the innovative first-floor layout, which includes a novel solution for accessing the loft. This approach avoids locating the new stair above the existing stairwell,  preserving the original volume and clearance in front of the stairwell's window. It’s a subtle yet clever rethinking of circulation, demonstrating how thoughtful design can solve practical challenges with elegance.

name: 143 Windsor Road
